ja78:1.1: A rich man was so miserly that Sakka took on his form, crippled though it was, to open the miserâ€™s vaults for the people. The king is asked to adjudicate his case, but cannot tell which is which.
ja78:1.4: The rich man was named after the Ilish herring (_illisa_), still popular for eating and, in modern times, threatened by overfishing, pollution, and global warming.
